common_japanese_leaks.感動するほどではない: nothing to write home about / not particularly impressive / not exactly moving
common_japanese_leaks.ありがたい作戦: brilliant strategy (SARCASTIC) / oh what a wonderful plan (IRONIC)
common_japanese_leaks.ありがたい: oh how wonderful (SARCASTIC) / oh great (IRONIC) / just peachy (SARCASTIC)
common_japanese_leaks.さすが: as expected (can be sarcastic) / of course / naturally
common_japanese_leaks.流石: as expected (can be sarcastic) / impressive (can be ironic)
common_japanese_leaks.素晴らしい: wonderful (can be sarcastic) / fantastic (can be ironic) / just great (SARCASTIC)
common_japanese_leaks.最高: the best (can be sarcastic) / perfect (can be ironic) / just perfect (SARCASTIC)
common_japanese_leaks.やったね: yay (can be sarcastic) / how nice (IRONIC) / oh joy (SARCASTIC)
common_japanese_leaks.なるほど: I see (can be dismissive) / uh-huh (SARCASTIC) / oh really (IRONIC)

pre_translation_checks.description: Ensure source text is properly identified as Japanese

post_translation_checks.description: Detect CJK characters outside allowed contexts
Detect sentences with mixed Vietnamese and CJK

system_instructions: CRITICAL: You are translating Japanese light novels to Vietnamese.
NEVER leave any Chinese (汉字), Japanese (ひらがな, カタカナ), or Korean (한글) characters in the Vietnamese output.
Only exception: Japanese terms in parentheses for clarification, e.g., (豚丼)
If you encounter a term you cannot translate, use Vietnamese phonetic approximation or descriptive translation.
Double-check your output for any remaining CJK characters before submitting.

few_shot_examples.bad: Không khí trong trường, sự喧騒喧 náo nhiệt lại càng lớn hơn.
few_shot_examples.good: Không khí trong trường, sự ồn ão náo nhiệt lại càng lớn hơn.
few_shot_examples.explanation: 喧騒 (xuân tào) means 'noisy/bustling' - must be translated to Vietnamese 'ồn ào'
这边 is Chinese for 'over here' - must be translated to Vietnamese 'đây này'
좌 is Korean character - must be fully translated to Vietnamese

few_shot_examples.bad: being made to feel thisドキドキ kind of thrill
few_shot_examples.good: being made to feel this heart-pounding kind of thrill
few_shot_examples.explanation: ドキドキ is Japanese onomatopoeia for heartbeat sound - must be translated to English 'heart-pounding' or 'thrilling'

few_shot_examples.bad: Not bad, but not exactly感動するほどではない…
few_shot_examples.good: Not bad, but nothing to write home about…
few_shot_examples.explanation: 感動するほどではない (kandou suru hodo dewa nai) is a Japanese phrase meaning 'not particularly impressive/moving' - must be fully translated to natural English idiom

few_shot_examples.bad: our leader Kaguya gave us theありがたい作戦 of,
few_shot_examples.good: our leader Kaguya gave us the brilliant strategy of,
few_shot_examples.explanation: ありがたい作戦 (arigatai sakusen) is SARCASTIC Japanese expression - literal 'grateful strategy' but means 'oh what a wonderful plan' (ironic). Context reveals sarcasm: the 'strategy' is just sound effects. Must translate with irony intact: 'brilliant strategy' (sarcasm clear from context)

few_shot_examples.bad: Theさすが master gives us advice
few_shot_examples.good: The oh-so-great master gives us advice
few_shot_examples.explanation: さすが (sasuga) means 'as expected/impressive' but often used sarcastically in light novels - context determines if genuine or ironic

few_shot_examples.bad: 素晴らしい plan you got there
few_shot_examples.good: What a wonderful plan you got there (sarcastic) / Oh great, another brilliant plan
few_shot_examples.explanation: 素晴らしい (subarashii) literally 'wonderful/splendid' - commonly used sarcastically in Japanese internet/otaku culture, similar to English 'oh great' or 'just fantastic'

multi_pass_validation.step1_initial_translation: Translate Japanese to Vietnamese with CJK awareness
multi_pass_validation.step2_cjk_detection: Run regex pattern matching to detect any remaining CJK
multi_pass_validation.step3_contextual_review: Check if detected CJK is in allowed context (parentheses, ruby text)
multi_pass_validation.step4_forced_retranslation: For flagged segments, explicitly request Vietnamese-only output
multi_pass_validation.step5_human_review: Final manual check for critical chapters

chunking_strategy.issue: Context window limits cause partial translations
chunking_strategy.solution: Translate in complete sentences/paragraphs, not mid-sentence
chunking_strategy.overlap: Include 2-3 sentences of overlap between chunks for context

type_1_single_character_leak.description: One or two CJK characters left untranslated in Vietnamese sentence
type_1_single_character_leak.root_cause: LLM context limit, compound word splitting, attention mechanism failure

type_2_phrase_leak.description: Short Chinese/Japanese phrase mixed with Vietnamese/English
examples: 様子 trong giờ câu lạc bộ
thisドキドキ kind of thrill
Not bad, but not exactly感動するほどではない…
our leader Kaguya gave us theありがたい作戦 of,
type_2_phrase_leak.root_cause: Multi-language training data interference, incomplete translation, onomatopoeia not recognized, phrase boundary detection failure

type_3_punctuation_leak.description: Japanese punctuation marks in Vietnamese text
type_3_punctuation_leak.root_cause: Tokenization treating punctuation separately from text

type_4_partial_word_leak.description: Part of compound word translated, part left as CJK

type_5_sarcastic_expression_leak.description: Japanese sarcastic/ironic expressions left untranslated - common in otaku/internet culture
examples: theありがたい作戦 of (the 'grateful strategy' - sarcastic)
Theさすが master (the 'as expected' master - ironic)
素晴らしい plan (wonderful plan - sarcastic)
最高 idea (the best idea - ironic)
やったね result (yay, what a result - sarcastic)
type_5_sarcastic_expression_leak.root_cause: LLM recognizes literal meaning but misses sarcastic tone, cultural context gap, irony not preserved in translation
type_5_sarcastic_expression_leak.frequency: moderate in light novels, common in comedy/slice-of-life genres
type_5_sarcastic_expression_leak.fix_difficulty: moderate (requires context analysis to determine if genuinely positive or sarcastic)

translation_guidelines.detection: Look for overly positive words (ありがたい, 素晴らしい, 最高, さすが) followed by obviously bad/silly content
translation_guidelines.strategy: Translate with English sarcastic markers: 'oh what a...', 'just perfect', 'brilliant' (when context is negative)
translation_guidelines.preservation: Maintain ironic tone - don't make sarcasm explicit with '(sarcastic)' tags unless absolutely necessary

usage_instructions.automated_validation: Run after Phase 2 translation, before Phase 3 Critics
manual_review_triggers: Any type_1 or type_2 errors detected
More than 5 type_3 errors in single chapter
Any CJK character in chapter titles or character names
integration_points: pipeline/modules/critics.py - Include CJK check in review criteria
